titles.title: Honoring four firefighters who lost their lives fighting the Thirtymile Fire in the Cascade Mountains of Washington State.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mrs. Davis, Jo Ann moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 201.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/23/2001--Passed House amended. Declares that the House of Representatives: (1) honors firefighters Tom Craven, Karen Fitzpatrick, Jessica Johnson, and Devin Weaver, who lost their lives fighting the Thirtymile Fire in the Cascade Mountains of Washington State, for their bravery and sacrifice in service to the Nation; (2) extends its deepest sympathies to their families and fellow firefighters; and (3) reaffirms its support and commitment to America's Federal firefighters.
